requirement_tested: Display a map interface for visualizing neighborhood data
user_persona: A city planner exploring different neighborhoods for development opportunities.
user_goal: To visualize neighborhood boundaries and data points on an interactive map.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing the Map Interface
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the application and sees the full-screen map interface with a toolbar at the top. The background is ivory, and the UI controls are forest green.
narrative_steps.action: Land on the main dashboard page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map loads with neighborhood boundaries displayed and a toolbar containing search, filter, and export icons.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Neighborhood Boundaries
narrative_steps.description: Alex clicks on a neighborhood boundary to select it. He notices the boundary highlights and a tooltip appears with basic information.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a neighborhood boundary.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The neighborhood is selected, and a tooltip shows its name and selected metric value.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating the Map
narrative_steps.description: Alex scrolls the mouse wheel to zoom in on the selected neighborhood to get a closer look at local features.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map zooms in or out depending on scroll direction.

requirement_tested: Allow users to select and compare multiple neighborhoods
user_persona: A researcher analyzing data across several areas for academic study.
user_goal: To select and compare data from multiple neighborhoods simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting First Neighborhood
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks on the first neighborhood on the map to begin comparison. The neighborhood appears in the selection bar below the map.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a neighborhood on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The neighborhood name appears in the horizontal selection bar at the bottom of the map.

narrative_steps.title: Adding More Neighborhoods
narrative_steps.description: Jamie clicks on a second neighborhood to add it to the comparison. Now two neighborhoods are shown in the bar.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a second neighborhood on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The second neighborhood is added to the selection bar alongside the first.

narrative_steps.title: Removing a Selected Neighborhood
narrative_steps.description: Jamie decides to remove one of the neighborhoods from the comparison. She clicks the remove button next to it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the remove button next to a neighborhood in the selection bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The selected neighborhood is removed from the comparison and disappears from the selection bar.

requirement_tested: Show demographic data for selected neighborhoods
user_persona: A community organizer reviewing population and income details for planning services.
user_goal: To view demographic data including population, age distribution, and household income for selected neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Demographic Cards
narrative_steps.description: Sam selects two neighborhoods on the map. Below the map, he sees demographic cards showing population and income data for each.
narrative_steps.action: Select two neighborhoods on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Demographic cards appear below the map, each representing a selected neighborhood with population and income statistics.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Detailed View
narrative_steps.description: Sam clicks on one of the demographic cards to see a detailed breakdown of age groups and income levels.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a demographic card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal opens displaying a detailed breakdown of age distribution and income levels for that neighborhood.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Charts
narrative_steps.description: Sam hovers over the chart in the demographic card to highlight corresponding data points.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over chart elements in a demographic card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Corresponding data points are highlighted on the chart.

requirement_tested: Show economic data for selected neighborhoods
user_persona: An economist evaluating employment and income trends across regions.
user_goal: To view economic data including employment rates and median household income for selected neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Economic Metrics
narrative_steps.description: Taylor selects a neighborhood and views the economic data section which includes a summary table and a chart.
narrative_steps.action: Select a neighborhood on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The economic data section appears below the demographic cards, showing a summary table and a chart.

narrative_steps.title: Expanding Metric Details
narrative_steps.description: Taylor clicks on an economic metric card to see a detailed breakdown of industries and income sources.
narrative_steps.action: Click on an economic metric card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Expanded details about industries and income sources are displayed for that neighborhood.

narrative_steps.title: Analyzing Chart Data
narrative_steps.description: Taylor hovers over the chart to see tooltips with precise values for employment and income metrics.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over chart lines or bars in the economic data section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tooltips appear with exact values for the hovered elements.

requirement_tested: Show crime data for selected neighborhoods
user_persona: A police analyst examining crime patterns in different areas.
user_goal: To view crime data including incident types and frequency for selected neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Crime Statistics
narrative_steps.description: Jordan selects a neighborhood and views the crime data panel showing heatmap and bar chart representations.
narrative_steps.action: Select a neighborhood on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Crime statistics appear in a separate panel with visual representations using heatmaps and bar charts.

narrative_steps.title: Filtering by Incident Type
narrative_steps.description: Jordan clicks on a specific crime category to filter the map and charts to show only that type of incident.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a crime category in the crime data panel.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map and charts update to show only incidents of the selected type.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Crime Clusters
narrative_steps.description: Jordan hovers over a crime cluster on the map to see a popup with details about incidents in that zone.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a crime cluster on the map.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A popup appears with details about the incidents in that particular zone.

requirement_tested: Provide interactive charts for visualizing demographic, economic, and crime data
user_persona: A data scientist creating visual reports for stakeholders.
user_goal: To interact with charts that visualize demographic, economic, and crime data.

narrative_steps.title: Rearranging Chart Components
narrative_steps.description: Morgan drags a chart component to a new position within the dashboard to customize the layout.
narrative_steps.action: Drag and drop a chart component.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The chart moves to the new position and the layout updates in real-time.

narrative_steps.title: Toggling Chart Series Visibility
narrative_steps.description: Morgan clicks on a legend item in one of the charts to hide or show specific data series.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a legend item in a chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The visibility of the corresponding chart series toggles between visible and hidden.

requirement_tested: Enable customization of dashboard layouts with draggable components
user_persona: A business user tailoring the dashboard to focus on relevant metrics.
user_goal: To customize the dashboard layout by moving and resizing panels.

narrative_steps.title: Moving Dashboard Panels
narrative_steps.description: Casey drags a panel containing demographic data to a preferred location on the dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Drag a panel to a new position.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The panel moves to the new position and the layout is updated instantly.

narrative_steps.title: Maximizing Panel View
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks the maximize icon on an economic data panel to expand it for better viewing.
narrative_steps.action: Click the maximize/minimize icon on a panel.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The panel expands to fill more space or returns to its original size.

requirement_tested: Support real-time data fetching from backend APIs
user_persona: A public policy analyst needing up-to-date neighborhood data.
user_goal: To ensure the latest neighborhood data is displayed by refreshing from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Triggering Data Refresh
narrative_steps.description: Lena clicks the refresh button to manually initiate a new data fetch from the backend API.
narrative_steps.action: Click the refresh button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A loading spinner appears, indicating ongoing data request, and the data updates.

narrative_steps.title: Monitoring Data Status
narrative_steps.description: Lena hovers over the loading spinner to confirm the status of the data fetch.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over the loading spinner.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tooltip appears showing the current data status.

requirement_tested: Implement a clean UI with ivory background and forest green accents
user_persona: A general user browsing the application for neighborhood insights.
user_goal: To experience a consistent and visually appealing interface with the specified color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Experiencing the Visual Design
narrative_steps.description: Zoe navigates to the main dashboard and observes that the background is ivory with forest green accents on all interactive elements.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the main dashboard page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire interface follows the design guidelines with ivory background and forest green UI elements.

requirement_tested: Allow users to filter data by time range or specific metrics
user_persona: A market researcher analyzing trends over time.
user_goal: To filter displayed data by time range or specific metrics.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Time Range Filter
narrative_steps.description: Pat selects 'Last Year' from the time range dropdown to apply the filter to all charts and tables.
narrative_steps.action: Select a time range from the dropdown menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All charts and tables update to display data filtered by the selected time range.

narrative_steps.title: Toggling Metric Visibility
narrative_steps.description: Pat toggles the 'Employment Rate' checkbox to hide it from the charts and tables.
narrative_steps.action: Toggle a metric checkbox.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The selected metric is hidden from the charts and tables.

requirement_tested: Enable export functionality for dashboard data and charts
user_persona: A data reporter preparing a summary document.
user_goal: To export dashboard data and charts into downloadable formats.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Export Process
narrative_steps.description: Riley clicks the export button in the top-right corner to start the export process.
narrative_steps.action: Click the export button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dialog box opens asking to choose the export format (PDF or CSV).

narrative_steps.title: Downloading Exported File
narrative_steps.description: Riley chooses PDF format and clicks to download the generated file.
narrative_steps.action: Choose PDF format and click download.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A PDF file containing the current dashboard data and visualizations is downloaded.

requirement_tested: Provide user authentication and session management
user_persona: A registered user accessing personalized dashboard features.
user_goal: To log in and access personalized dashboard settings.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Samantha enters her credentials on the login screen and clicks the login button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the login button with valid credentials.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard with her profile icon visible.

narrative_steps.title: Logging Out
narrative_steps.description: Samantha clicks the logout link to end her session.
narrative_steps.action: Click the logout link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Her session ends and she is redirected back to the login screen.

requirement_tested: Include search functionality to find specific neighborhoods
user_persona: A local resident looking for a specific area.
user_goal: To quickly locate a neighborhood by name or address.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for a Neighborhood
narrative_steps.description: Morgan types 'Downtown' into the search bar and sees live suggestions.
narrative_steps.action: Type in the search bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Live suggestions appear based on matching neighborhood names.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Suggestion
narrative_steps.description: Morgan clicks on the suggested 'Downtown' neighborhood to center the map and select it for comparison.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a search suggestion.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map centers on the selected neighborhood and it is added to the comparison.

requirement_tested: Ensure responsive design for desktop and mobile devices
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the app on a smartphone.
user_goal: To navigate the application smoothly on a small screen.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating on Mobile
narrative_steps.description: Taylor accesses the application on a mobile device and swipes left to navigate between tabs.
narrative_steps.action: Swipe left on the mobile screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Navigation between tabs or datasets occurs smoothly.

narrative_steps.title: Zooming on Touchscreen
narrative_steps.description: Taylor pinches the map to zoom in and out on the touchscreen.
narrative_steps.action: Pinch the map on the touchscreen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map zooms in or out according to the pinch gesture.

requirement_tested: Integrate PostgreSQL database with environment variables for connection
user_persona: A system administrator verifying database connectivity.
user_goal: To confirm that the application connects securely to the PostgreSQL database using defined environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Database Connection
narrative_steps.description: The system checks if the application connects to the PostgreSQL instance using the environment variables DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend service.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database using the specified environment variables.
